page.title: 12EDUCATION IN GARFORTH
page.content: Children start school in a nursery at about three years old, and finish usually at sixteen at the Comprehensive School. If they are going on to college or university they stay at the Comprehensive School till they are eighteen. There is only one Comprehensive School and it has over a thousand pupils. There are ten Infant and Junior Schools each having around two hundred pupils somewhere between three and eleven years of age. Our own school, Ninelands Lane Junior School, was built about twenty years ago. It used to have around seven hundred pupils. The oldest school in Garforth is the Parochial School on Main Street. It was built over two hundred years ago and at that time was the only school in Garforth. It is now a Junior School.
